metadata.title: CVE-2021-27927 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
In Zabbix from 4.0.x before 4.0.28rc1, 5.0.0alpha1 before 5.0.10rc1, 5.2.xbefore 5.2.6rc1, and 5.4.0alpha1 before 5.4.0beta2, theCControllerAuthenticationUpdate controller lacks a CSRF protectionmechanism. The code inside this controller calls diableSIDValidation insidethe init() method. An attacker doesn't have to know Zabbix user logincredentials, but has to know the correct Zabbix URL and contact informationof an existing user with sufficient privileges.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-27927` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

zabbix-agent - 1:5.0.8+dfsg-1
zabbix-agent2 - 1:5.0.8+dfsg-1
zabbix-frontend-php - 1:5.0.8+dfsg-1
zabbix-java-gateway - 1:5.0.8+dfsg-1
zabbix-proxy-mysql - 1:5.0.8+dfsg-1
zabbix-proxy-pgsql - 1:5.0.8+dfsg-1
zabbix-proxy-sqlite3 - 1:5.0.8+dfsg-1
zabbix-server-mysql - 1:5.0.8+dfsg-1
zabbix-server-pgsql - 1:5.0.8+dfsg-1
zabbix-web-service - 1:5.0.8+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: zabbix package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:5.0.8+dfsg-1').
